Lord Malgus. Clan Varad is no more.
Yes. Mandalore himself has sent a broadcast decrying the cowardice of Varad's warriors.
The other clans will accept the dishonored survivors into their lowest ranks. And no Mandalorian will break a pact with the Empire again.
All it cost was a few colonies and the lives of our enemies.
Lesson taught, then.
The public story doesn't matter. Clan Varad acted boldly, and its warriors died well.
They did fight honorably.
They chose their fate, and died as they deserved.
Only a fool believes that.
If you think my predictions optimistic, you may take it up with the Dark Council. But the Mandalorians are under control.
As for the stolen Republic vessel, the Science Bureau is dissecting it as we speak.
We now possess the latest Republic security codes and fleet positions; an unexpected boon, and one of great value.
If Clan Varad had been more patient, they could have fought the Republic with us.
War really is coming.
When the day comes, I trust you will be ready.
Maybe Clan Varad died serving the Empire after all.
Varad was useful.
Perhaps.
Then the job's over.
Enough of this.
Interesting, how we acquired a Republic warship without breaking the treaty. How did Clan Varad learn about it, again?
Suspiciously convenient.
I expect the chieftain took that knowledge to his grave.
Go with the Empire's gratitude, and that of Mandalore.

This is Vaiken Spacedock to Darth Malgus, awaiting instructions.
Good. Time is short, and I will be brief.
You are aware of the Empire's pact with the Mandalorians; the mercenary clans supported us during the war, and we paid them well.
But the treaty has made them restless. Now Clan Varad has broken with the Mandalorian leadership and declared "akaan'gaan"--the search for battle.
The fools know nothing of battle; nor are they worthy of it.
Arrogant toy soldiers.
For all their foolishness, they are stronger than you would believe.
Would that we could all have such simple goals.
Stupid, but unsurprising.
I admire their passion, but their methods are self-destructive.
With no one to control them, they'll become animals. Who've they attacked?
They're off their leash.
I've worked with Mandalore and the clans. They're good fighters, and honorable people.
They have my respect.
Which is why this insult carries weight.
My experience with these "mercenary clans" is limited. The Mandalorians are a warrior culture?
Tell me about Mandalorians.
Millennia old, devoted to honor and glory. The clans are comprised of different species, but all pledge loyalty to their leader, Mandalore.
I know the Mandalorians, but I've never heard of Clan Varad.
Clan Varad?
They have always been aggressive to a fault, and their chieftain, Mavrix, trains each of his warriors personally. Failures are hunted for sport.
We held back too long. War against the Republic gave men purpose.
Peace makes everyone restless.
You may be right--but we must remember who our enemies are.
Clan Varad has begun a series of raids against both Republic and Imperial colonies, slaughtering our soldiers and demanding tribute.
These traitors must be eliminated. I have persuaded Mandalore to sanction their destruction and provide their location.
Has Mandalore upheld his promise?
Where's the clan's base?
His scouts--those who were not returned in pieces--tracked Varad to the Tamarin Sector.
I'd think the Mandalorians would want to handle this renegade clan themselves.
The politics sound delicate.
They do, but our alliance has become fragile and leaders in the Empire no longer trust them.
I'm surprised Mandalore didn't want his own people hunting the renegades.
Why isn't Mandalore in charge?
Clan Varad attacked the Empire, and the Empire must respond.
There is another complication, however; this message was intercepted by Imperial Intelligence.
If Clan Varad wants a fight, they'll be waiting for just such an attack.
They could be setting a trap.
Which is why their defeat will be an example to any other clans courting rebellion. But you're right to think it a trap--observe.
...the Allusis was being upgraded at the Fondor shipyards when the Mandalorians attacked.
That ship was supposed to be the vanguard of the fleet--if a renegade clan is using it as a base of operations, we need to get it back.
That was the Grand Master of the Jedi Order explaining how Clan Varad stole a Republic battle cruiser. This vessel is your target.
I want to know the capabilities of that ship, and who's on board.
Tell me about the opposition.
The ship's armaments include heavy turbolaser and ion cannons manned by several hundred Mandalorian commandos.
Why not find a target for Clan Varad's aggression? You might bring them back under your employ.
Negotiation might be possible.
Efforts were made, but the situation has deteriorated. Clan Varad thinks us weak--they must not begin a Mandalorian uprising.
Clan Varad shall be destroyed.
Imperial destroyers will escort you to the battle cruiser and draw its fire. Board it and eliminate Clan Varad's commanders.
When you are finished, you may return their crippled Republic vessel to Dromund Kaas--it will make a fine trophy.
